Case reference: 2017056566.CaseDesc: Darryl Gundrum was last seen between March 1 and September 30, 1970, near Sherwood Park, Alberta.

Case reference: 2013000097.CaseDesc: On January 25th, 1981, police received a call regarding the drowning of Deanne Bousquet. Three children were playing on the ice on the river when two of the children broke through. Deanne was unable to pull herself out and was last seen going under the water. Ice in the area was very thin due to warm water being dumped by the mill. All efforts made to locate Deanne were negative.

Case reference: 2016061155.CaseDesc: This partial skull was found on May 22, 2013 on the Georgian Bay Shoreline, French River Provincial Park. The post-mortem interval is lengthy. The skull is that of an adult, possibly an older adult. Radiocarbon dating indicates that the individual lived at least some portion of their life between 1950 and 1963. The post-mortem interval is at least a couple of years and could be up to 60 years.

Case reference: 2020050890.CaseDesc: On August 9, 2020, days after the death of her son, Audrey Beaver was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. That day, Audrey had told her family that she planned on setting up a tent to live in.

Case reference: 2018063467.CaseDesc: On December 12, 1995, at approximately 2:00 am, Ahmad Kharashfeh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Jacket: Leather, Black, Short jacket with 2 red lines in the front

Case reference: 2006014099.CaseDesc: Lee Kerton was reported missing when he failed to return from a fishing trip on September 17, 1977, on Wakomata Lake in Ontario, Casson Township.

Case reference: 2014005961.CaseDesc: Chris Metallic had been attending a party at a residence in Sackville on Saturday night but was last seen in Sackville at approximately 3 a.m. on Sunday, November 25, 2012. A search for Mr. Metallic focused on a wooded area and river off of Route 940 heading toward Shemogue after information was received that a person was seen walking on the Upper Aboujagne Road around 5:30 a.m. on Sunday morning.

Deformity: Unknown, Crooked fingers on left hand

Case reference: 2008008198.CaseDesc: Gerald Hart was last seen at around midnight on Christmas Eve on Symmes St, travelling on foot towards Main St in the City of Niagara Falls (the casino district).  Mr. Hart was reported to have been in an intoxicated state.

Case reference: 2015066612.CaseDesc: On December 7, 2015, Sheree Fertuck was seen for the last time driving a red 1998 International semi truck and trailer near Kenaston, Saskatchewan. The following morning her semi was located with several personal items inside it, including her cellular phone, keys and jacket.

Case reference: 2015050297.CaseDesc: On April, 23, 1973, Lucie Gélinas was seen for the last time in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. She was supposed to go to Vancouver, British Columbia with a friend. Investigations were conducted and the location of Lucie and her friend have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2017000313.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1999, the burned body of a male was found in a garage fire in downtown Edmonton. The individual may have had a slightly deformed nose from an old fracture.

Case reference: 2016064545.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2007, skeletal remains of a man were discovered in a farmer's field near the Athabasca River. It is possible that these remains came from the river. This individual did not have any upper teeth and likely wore dentures. The sacrum was deformed and there is a possibility that he walked with a limp.

Case reference: 2009004799.CaseDesc: Neil McDougall left Three-Way Demolition in Durham on Friday, October 11, 1985 with a co-worker and went home. He had an argument with his wife and the friend left. After supper Mr. McDougall went to Ayton, to the Commercial Hotel. He left the hotel with someone else and they met up elsewhere with the co-worker.  Mr. McDougall returned to the hotel and left at closing time, between 1:30 – 1:40 am. He was last reported leaving a residence on Edmund Street, Ayton at 2 a.m. October 12, 1985. His pickup truck was discovered near Ayton later that day. The ashtray was filled with different brands of cigarette butts. He has been described as meticulous, habitual, responsible and hardworking. When he went missing, Neil was planning to adopt his wife's children. Foul play is suspected. Mr. McDougall was declared legally dead in 1996.

Jacket: Blue, Work style with name on it

Case reference: 2014001852.CaseDesc: Ms. RUNNINGBIRD was out near Swan Lake.  She walked away from her friends and never returned.

Case reference: 2018040311.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2003, Karanjeet Singh was seen for the last time as he left with some of his personal belongings to go visit a friend in Toronto, Ontario. Karanjeet was visiting Toronto from India and was due to return on May 24.

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 2016059681.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2016, at approximately 7:30 a.m., Asal Baradran and her father, Amir Baradran, were seen for the last time leaving their home in Toronto, Ontario. The pair had advised that they would be back at 8:00 p.m., but did not return home.

Case reference: 2006004799.CaseDesc: Ralph Monague and Curtis Smith were passengers on the Christian Island Ferry travelling between Cedar Point and Christian Island on December 22, 1985, when they fell over board in stormy conditions.

Case reference: 2017047335.CaseDesc: On July 30, 2017, skeletal remains were found at the Montreal River Harbor located on Lake Superior. The location is approximately one hour north of Sault Ste. Marie on Highway 17. The Ontario Forensic Pathology Service has been able to determine that the remains are that of a male age 50-100 years old. Found on him was Canadian currency dated 2016, therefore it is believed he may have been there as early as the Spring of 2016. It is unknown how the male travelled to this area, but it is believed that he may have taken a bus, walked or hitchhiked.  He was carrying a back pack with camping supplies along with a firearm that would have been concealed in a cardboard box. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts that this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2017074201.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1995, the remains of an unidentified man were discovered in Lake Ontario, near Cherry Beach, in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he may be of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2021054828.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2021, at approximately 6:30 p.m., Berhanei Peynado was seen for the last time in the area of Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Berhanei was despondent.

Shoes: Black, White, RUNNING, Brand: Air Jordan
Coat: Black, WINTER, Winter coat with fur collar
Hat: Black, Gold, BASEBALL, Baseball hat with gold maple leaf
Tattoo: Chest, Wolf, arc angel with sword

Case reference: 2014004181.CaseDesc: On July 2, 1984, Yves Jodouin was seen for the last time as he was dropped off at a venue in Ottawa, Ontario. Yves had received permission to leave the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario to attend a show. Later that evening, he had phoned his family to advise he would be running late.

Case reference: 2014001603.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1992, Richard Liboiron was seen for the last time as he left a hotel in Gatineau, Quebec. Mr. Liboiron and a friend departed from the hotel on a snowmobile heading in the direction towards Ottawa. The two crossed the Ottawa River and did not make it to the shore.

Case reference: 2014005643.CaseDesc: On October 21, 2008, it was reported a boat had capsized in Lake Winnipeg, 15 miles south east of Poplar River between Marchand Point and George Island. The boat left Poplar Point on Oct 20, 2008, to remove buoys from Lake Winnipeg. During the evening, the boat experienced technical difficulties and was unable to continue. Throughout the early morning hours the weather began to worsen, experiencing 10 foot waves, at this time the vessel started to take in water. As a result the boat began to sink. Two of the three passengers were able to make it to Marchand's Point where they were rescued. No foul play is suspected and it is presumed George Donald Everett drowned.

Jacket: Nylon, Black, zippered Bomber style with "Berens River" patch on back

Case reference: 2014003365.CaseDesc: At approximately 2:00 p.m. on October 30, 1982, Daniel Christensen left the family cabin in the area of Long Lake, Manitoba. He left with the family dog and his intention was to go chicken hunting. His family reported him missing the next day.  On November 6, 1982, the family dog returned to the cabin in good health. Mr. Christensen has never been located.

Case reference: 2014003023.CaseDesc: Joseph Roussel was last seen climbing Mount Edith Cavell in Jasper National Park.

Case reference: 2014003751.CaseDesc: Lucien Sale was last seen driving his truck in Chisholm, Alberta on September 21, 1991. On September 26, 1991, his truck was located abandoned on a logging road off into the bush.

Case reference: 2017010385.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2015, at approximately 2:00 p.m., Fadi Zakir was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2014002363.CaseDesc: On January 7, 1997, Darcy Puddicomb was seen for the last time. He departed his residence that morning with the intention of attending work. He did not arrive.

Case reference: 2006018799.CaseDesc: Michael Recollet was last seen on August 20, 1991 at Okeechobee Lodge Dock, in Fraser Point. He was  heading in a westerly direction towards Birch Island by boat. His 16 foot cedar strip boat and 25HP Mariner motor were recovered near Mary's Point, Little La Cloche Island.

Case reference: 2014002159.CaseDesc: Jason Misurko was last known to be in Fort McMurray, Alberta on September 17, 1995. There have been no sightings or contact since then. His vehicle was later recovered in Enderby, B.C.

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2006003799.CaseDesc: On September 28, 2002, a Black male, believed to be between the ages of 20 to 30 years old, was found in Lake Ontario, approximately 1 mile south of Bluffers Park, at the foot of Brimley Road in Toronto. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs and his length was measured at 5’9”-5’11”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been dead for a few days.

Teeth: Had natural teeth with no restorations.
Underwear: White, Logo "X-20" on the elastic band. The elastic band was tied on right side, as if they were too big.

Case reference: 2014006276.CaseDesc: On September 25, 2013, Mohamed Ali Qazi was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. At the time of his disappearance, Mohamed was in a Chevrolet Malibu rental vehicle that was later located in a shopping center in the city of Terrebonne, Quebec. His friend, Pierre Daniel, was also reported missing. The two men were often together.

Case reference: 2014004932.CaseDesc: Mathieu Daneau's disappearance occurred on April 3, 2007 in the region of St-Hyacinthe, Quebec. Mr. Daneau was admitted for treatment at the L'Envolée center. He left the center and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2015011647.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1994, the body of a woman was found floating in the St. Lawrence River at St-Jean Baptiste Street in the Pointe aux Trembles area of Montreal. She took good care of her teeth and according to experts the body would have been in the water for about 4 months.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Black, black pattern on the side and orthopedic supports in acrylic brown and red in both shoes
Scar: Chest, right and left breast surgery
Chest, has possibly undergone a partial ablation

Case reference: 2021033500.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2021, at approximately 2:40 p.m., Yaoschuwach Asselin was seen for the last time at his home in the Saint-Michel neighbourhood in Montreal, Quebec. Yaoschuwach left without taking any of his personal belongings, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Wears beard and mustache, medium length hair

Case reference: 2013000109.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1996, Huguette Douville was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. She walks with an irregular gait, specifically a hunchback posture and always carries grocery bags. Huguette regularly hitchhikes.

Case reference: 2016034244.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on October 31, 1981 about 7 kms east of Hinton, AB just off Highway #16. The individual did not have teeth and no dentures were found with the body.

Case reference: 2006006199.CaseDesc: Donald Douma has been missing since May 19, 1981. Donald was an avid outdoorsman and he occasionally hitchiked. He was last seen leaving home on a blue CCM bicycle. Donald Douma had expressed interest in moving out West and his family believes that is where he may have gone to.

Teeth: Crooked, Some dental work, upper front tooth has had some white fillings.

Case reference: 2014002572.CaseDesc: André Demange was last seen on September 2, 1983, in Montreal, Quebec. André's personal effects were found a few days later near the water close to Des Ormeaux and Bellerive street.

Case reference: 2020032438.CaseDesc: On August 18, 2020, Jean-Louis Desrosiers was seen for the last time around noon at a business in the city of Gatineau, Quebec. He was driving a 2009 4-door grey Hyundai Elantra. Jean-Louis has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2012020173.CaseDesc: On April 23, 1984, the body of an unidentified man was discovered east of Cypress Bowl Road, along the Skyline trail, near Mile 5 on the Hollyburn Mountain in Vancouver, British Colombia.

Case reference: 2013000114.CaseDesc: Abigail Andrews, a single Metis woman, lived in a basement suite in Fort St. John. She worked at FSJ Fashions, and The Frontier Bar and Grill. She was pregnant but not yet showing. Abigail was last seen on the evening of April 7, 2010 walking from her home towards a friend's house.

Teeth: Good, Used a dental pallet retainer
Deformity: Right Index Finger, Previously broken and healed in a deformed position

Case reference: 2019007309.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2018, Robert Campbell was seen for the last time as he left work in Toronto, Ontario. Robert had not been seen for three months before he was reported missing.

Case reference: 2014006416.CaseDesc: On January 24, 2014, at approximately 10:15 a.m., Richard Hicks was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001004.CaseDesc: The remains of this unidentified male were found on Keats Island, near Gibsons, on May 3, 1992.

Case reference: 2008023299.CaseDesc: In the early morning hours of June 30, 2001, Istefan Toma returned home after work. He showered, changed his clothes and was observed leaving the family home at approximately 1 a.m. in his own vehicle. It was later discovered he had taken his identification and citizenship card, but did not take any clothing or other belongings with him. His vehicle was recovered from a parking lot in the vicinity of his work place at Woodbridge Mall (Hwy 7/Martingrove, Woodbridge, Ontario) on the 11th of February 2002, having been parked there for approximately 6-9 months. Mr. Toma has not been in contact with any family members nor his employers since he left his home on the morning of June 30, 2001. Mr. Toma speaks broken English, is known to smoke DuMaurier cigarettes and has been known to attend casinos on occasion. Mr. Toma's family and the police are concerned for his safety and well-being.

Mark: Nose, Mole on the right side of the nose

Case reference: 2013000045.CaseDesc: On September 14, 1964, at approximately 11:00 p.m., Noreen Greenly was seen for the last time leaving her friend’s house. Noreen had told her friend that she was going to wait for the bus at the bus stop across the street. The bus driver was interviewed and he stated that he did not pick her up. A witness had reported seeing a young girl get into a small blue car, and sit close to the driver at approximately the same time and location. The car was described as a 1957 to 1959 Ford Perfect which was in good condition.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Blue, A thin necklace with blue pendant
Purse: Dark Blue, dome fastener, change purse with $0.70 inside
Scar: Right Knee, Center of knee cap

Case reference: 2014002718.CaseDesc: Wayne Robinson was last seen on October 8, 1985, running away from his school in God's Lake, Manitoba. It is unclear what prompted Wayne to leave school during the recess period. An extensive air, water and land search was conducted with no success.

Case reference: 2005002399.CaseDesc: On December 30, 1984, an unidentified Caucasian female was found in a ditch near Napanee, Ontario, approximately five kilometers south of the Village of Newburgh and four kilometers north of the Palace Road exit from Highway #401. She was estimated to have been there for 2-5 months.

Hair: Blonde, Dark blonde hair, shorter than collar with moderate curl

Case reference: 2006011799.CaseDesc: Thomas Lyon was last seen in the area of Iron Bridge, Pelican Lake, Sioux Lookout on June 28, 1998 by two acquaintances.  He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014006028.CaseDesc: On January 18th, 2013, the Teton family checked into the New Otani Inn, located in Yokohama, Japan.  This was to be the final destination before returning to Canada.  While Henrik was in the shower, his wife Chieko and 1 year old son Takaya vanished. Henrik sought the assistance of police in Yokohama and the Canadian Embassy, to no avail. Shortly thereafter, Henrik attended 52 Division to report the incident and his subsequent attempt to locate his family. Toronto Police requested the assistance of Japanese police to confirm Chieko’s and Takaya’s well-being and Chieko’s intentions.  It was confirmed that both are in good health and that Chieko does not wish her whereabouts be disclosed.

Case reference: 2013000066.CaseDesc: Jean Corbeil was last seen on May 25, 1977 in Montreal, Quebec. Jean left his home in the De Lorimier district and was never seen or heard from since.

Sweater: Beige, with "USA Army" on the front

Case reference: 2014005589.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1971, Lillian Giroux was seen for the last time when she was left with relatives in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014002896.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1981, at around 10:00pm, Madeleine Thibault was seen for the last time on Commercial Road in Lévis, Québec. While leaving her house, Madeleine mentioned that she was going to her mother's for a visit.

Jewelry: Gold, COLLIER, Chain with two hearts
Mark: Mouth, Beauty mark on the left side

Case reference: 2009247848.CaseDesc: Christopher and Alexander are missing from the York region but were located in Poland where they are residing with their non-custodial mother.

Case reference: 2014001879.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1983, Patrick Auger left his residence in Desmarais, Alberta, to travel to Slave Lake, Alberta. On November 1, 1983, Patrick was observed getting onto a Greyhound Bus bound for Peace River, Alberta, from Slave Lake.

Deformity: Right Fourth Toe, Deformed from previous fracture
Right Large Toe, Toe twisted from healed fracture

Case reference: 2012020010.CaseDesc: Jacek Laskowski was reported missing on May 3, 2005, from Calgary, AB.  Information suggests that he may have been last seen in the Golden, BC area.

Case reference: 2014002608.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1998, Jong Donohue was seen for the last time as he departed from Camrose, Alberta. It is possible that Jong may have had plans to travel to Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006016699.CaseDesc: Michael Gadke and Morris Werenko were last seen in around Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario, and were last heard from as they were circling over Goulais Bay in a Cessna C-172 aircraft. The Cessna C-172, had white wings with red tips, a red fuselage with white stripe and white underside. Top of engine cowling was red.

Case reference: 2014002223.CaseDesc: Edward Joesph Arcand left his residence in Coleman, Alberta on June 8, 1975, driving a 1969 Ford Falcon station wagon.  On June 15, 1975 his vehicle was found abandoned 80 km north of Coleman on highway 940.  Mr. Arcand has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2013000140.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1981, Rene Laflamme was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. René had visited his mother in Ottawa, Ontario and had left her residence to travel back to Montreal.

Case reference: 2016010572.CaseDesc: Richard Jones was last seen at his family’s residence in Brantford in late fall of 1975 and has not been seen since. Mr. Jones was also enrolled in the Graphic Design course at Sheridan College’s Oakville Campus in September of 1975.

Case reference: 2019071422.CaseDesc: On December 7, 2019, Kidist Mohamed was seen for the last time near Brant Street and King Street West in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2017004181.CaseDesc: On January 16, 2017, Glen Swanton was seen for the last time in the area of Minden Hills, Ontario.  Mr. Swanton’s abandoned vehicle was later located in the area of Kinmount, Ontario, on January 18, 2017.

Foreign Object: Left Wrist, Metal plate in his wrist

Case reference: 2014006179.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, Burnaby RCMP were advised that Lon Batchelor had sent his brother a letter requesting he become his power of attorney and that he give his daughter a good-bye note (stating that Lon was "going for the long walk"). This is out of character for Lon. Anyone having seen Lon since July 1, 2013, or who may be able to provide any information as to his whereabouts, is asked to contact the police.

Case reference: 2014006077.CaseDesc: Schuyler Bierkos was last seen by his roommate at his home in Calgary, Alberta on February 24, 2013. The reason for his disapearance is unknown.

Hair: Blonde, Other, Usually has a beard
Scar: Head, severe acne and scars on face

Case reference: 2005007399.CaseDesc: On June 21, 1985, an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 20 to 40 years of age, was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist docks. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170-190 lbs and his length was measured at 5’7”-5’10”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Brown, Curly, Shoulder, Dark moustache
Teeth: He has multiple amalgam fillings and his wisdom teeth are fully erupted.
Chain: Gold, 20 inch, 10K gold, fine weave chain necklace.
Shoes: Leather, Brown, Reddish brown leather Olympian brand shoes (extra wide).
Pants: Blue, Plaid, Grand National Trousers brand, size 36
Underwear: Blue, White, Mentug brand briefs, size large

Case reference: 2017074170.CaseDesc: On October 8, 2015, an unidentified man was found in Lake Ontario in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001622.CaseDesc: On the evening of October 17, 1982, Clayton Mark Bussiere was last seen while driving his taxi cab on Lougheed Highway (Highway 7) in Mission, British Columbia. Mr. Bussiere's taxi cab, a 1978 blue Pontiac Lemans, has never been located. It is unclear as to whether or not Mr. Bussiere had a passenger at the time of his disappearance.

Shoes: Leather, Brown, Lace up shoes; brand: Downunders
Sweater: Grey, Zippered Cardigan with Elbow Patches
Jewelry: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Saint Christopher Medal necklace

Case reference: 2014004796.CaseDesc: Shirley Lee Cletheroe was last seen on June 9, 2006 in the Fort St. John area. She has had no contact with her friends or family since that date.

Case reference: 2008018199.CaseDesc: Carl Braum and Thomas Lumsden were last seen on the morning of May 19, 1974, in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe, travelling in a northerly direction in the area of Depot Harbor. It was believed that they were travelling to the Killbear Park area. There were no lifejackets in the canoe.

Case reference: 2014004931.CaseDesc: On April 27, 2007, Vimla Patel was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Vimla said she was planning on visiting a family member for the weekend.

Case reference: 2014006991.CaseDesc: Maxime Perreault was living alone and in an isolated area in the municipality of East Bolton and was working in the municipality of Eastman, in the Eastern Townships region of Quebec. On April 28, 2014, Maxime contacted his family and friends stating that he would visit them around May 3, 2014 in Beloeil, Quebec. He never arrived. He usually travels on foot, by bike, by bus or hitchhiking with a navy blue backpack.

Case reference: 2014004013.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1997, Eric Pouliot said he was departing to go up north for a maximum of 48 hours, but he never returned. He had little money and no vehicle. At the time of his disappearance, Eric lived in the LeMoyne district of Longueuil, Quebec for one week.

Case reference: 2020009578.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1989, at approximately 1:00am, Andrew Gunzinger was seen for the last time leaving his girlfriend’s father’s farm near Orangeville, Ontario. Prior to leaving, Andrew and his girlfriend had gotten into a dispute.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2006005999.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1994, the body of a male was found in the Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 120 lbs and his length was measured approximately 5’8"-5’9", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was circumcised and his appendix was present. It is estimated that he had been in the water for a few days to several weeks.

Teeth: Natural teeth with amalgam fillings on numerous teeth
Scar: Left Forearm, Z-plasty scar, 6x5x7cm, may have been the result of plastic surgery following a fracture
Right Ring Finger, Small linear scar on the knuckle, 2cm

Case reference: 2014005024.CaseDesc: On November 16, 2007, Pierre Landry was seen for the last time in the area of Saint-Joseph-de-Beauce, Quebec. Pierre would have left his residence on foot and there are no indications in the direction he would have taken.

Case reference: 2014004933.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1987, at approximately 7:00pm, Jimmy Hong was last seen by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. His friend indicated that Jimmy had left for Hamilton, Ontario, and would be returning the following Monday.

Case reference: 2014003039.CaseDesc: Réal Généreux was last seen on October 20, 1980, in Montreal. He was a taxi driver and was known to frequent a tavern on Mont-Royal Street. Following an accident, Réal had difficulty walking due to pain he had in his spine.

Case reference: 2008009598.CaseDesc: Mario Palermo was reported missing on January 20, 1978, by his mother. At that time, Mr. Palermo was living at home and was single. The last contact family members had with him was on January 8, 1978 when his mother received a Grey Coach parcel sent from Orillia which contained a pair of boots that he had borrowed from his brother and two boxes of chocolates.

Case reference: 2016068154.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from Gough Creek at the east end of Queen Street, in Kapuskasing. This area is known to have been used by vagrants and others as a place for consuming alcohol. It is estimated that he had been in the water for approximately 10 days prior to discovery.

Teeth: Several of his teeth are missing and he has cavities

Case reference: 2012020036.CaseDesc: On April 20, 2009, at approximately 5:00 p.m., Monique Mattar was seen for the last time in the northeast community of Greenview in Calgary, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Monqiue was leading a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014004896.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2002, Aiqiu Chen was seen for the last time as she was leaving her brother’s home in Toronto, Ontario. Aiqiu left with all of her belongings.

Case reference: 2012020042.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1991, Jennifer Anne Regan was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Chest, Collar bone, according to medical records from 1985
Left Wrist, According to medical records from 1985

Case reference: 2006011299.CaseDesc: Henry Atlookan left Whiteclay Lake in a canoe to travel 55 km to Armstrong, Ontario. He may have been seen on June 25, 1968 making a purchase at a local store in the Town of Armstrong. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005581.CaseDesc: On March 23, 2011, at approximately 11:00 p.m., Steven Lapowich was last seen at Pearson International Airport in Toronto, Ontario. Steven boarded a flight to Puerto Rico, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2014046118.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an adult male were found on Little Shell Island near Sidney, British Columbia in 2012. The man’s age was estimated between 20 and 60 years old, and may have gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2005000599.CaseDesc: On May 18, 2005, this male, believed to be Caucasian was found on the bank of a reservoir in the "Pine Valley Open Space" located at 7211 Pine Valley Road, north of Highway 7, in Vaughan, Ontario. Nearby bed linens, clothing, personal belongings and food suggest that this person was homeless and living by the reservoir. The state of preservation of the remains is suggestive of a lengthy time since death (greater than one year) however, a newspaper dated to January 9, 2005 was found amongst this man's belongings suggesting a post-mortem interval of 4 months.

Teeth: Poor dentition with loss of most teeth. Teeth in his upper jaw have amalgam restorations.
Jacket: Black, Dark Green, Mark's Work Wearhouse, winter
Deformity: Right Eye, A lesion, likely a tumor of the face
Amputation: Left Little Finger, end of the finger

Case reference: 2014002762.CaseDesc: On March 3rd, 1982, Laurence Peterson and Randolph Johanson were reported missing by Mr. Johanson’s girlfriend. Mr. Johanson and Mr. Peterson were last seen on February 28th, 1982, leaving the Shelter Island Marina, on their boats. Mr. Johanson was reportedly using his 26 ft. long salvage tug boat to haul Mr. Peterson’s 43 ft. wooden halibut fishing vessel to Lund, BC. The men were reported missing when they did not arrive at their destination. Extensive searches were unsuccessful. It has been speculated that the two men disappeared to start a new life.

Teeth: Other, Wide space in between the front teeth
Scar: Chest, 1 inch scar on left breast

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2014002334.CaseDesc: Gary Percival was reported missing in Regina, SK on April 9, 1973. A witness did state that Gary Percival may have been a patient in a hospital in New York State in 1974. Mr. Percival has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002936.CaseDesc: On February 3, 1988, David Ambroise, then 3 years old, was playing near the Saint-Maurice River in the First Nations reserve of Wemotaci. David approached too close to the water, slipped and fell in. He was then swept away by the current, and has never been found despite searches.

Case reference: 2014005358.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2007, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Ana Jimenez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Ana’s daughter found that her mother and all of her personal belongings were gone. Ana had been visiting from Columbia and was due to return on September 27, but never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2014005158.CaseDesc: Mr. Frederick Lagrelle was last seen on April 12, 1997 in the area of the Sunchild and O’Chiese First Nations in Alberta. It is possible Mr. Lagrelle was seen in Rocky Mountain House, Alberta days after. He was known to walk with a cane and wear a leg/knee brace. Mr. Lagrelle was described by family as having an intellectual disability as a result of a past accident.

Case reference: 2018055666.CaseDesc: On October 18, 1991, Kristina Rhodes was seen for the last time in Port Elgin, Ontario. Kristina was also known to frequent the towns of Southampton and Hanover, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006184.CaseDesc: On October 15, 1977, Jacques Chaput left the family home in Trois-Rivières, Quebec following a disagreement he had with his mother and he never returned. Numerous steps were taken by his family to locate him, but they were unsuccessful. Jacques was officially declared missing by his family in 2013.
